THE UNIVERSITY OF TENNESSEE
DIVISION OF UNIVERSITY EXTENSION
BOX S-45D, UNIVERSITY STATION
KNOXVILLE
RADIO AND TELEVISION SERVICES
RADIO STATION WUOT
June 14, 1954
Mr, John Holt
National Association of Educational Broadcasters
14 Gregory Hall
University of Illinois
Urbana, Illinois
Dear John:
I'm afraid the task of commenting on -the rather involved
and erudite series outlined by Dr, Kirk is too difficult to
handle without more information. For my taste, it sounds very
interesting and worthwhile, but I have some reservations about
putting it on the air until we know a bit more about it.
An audition tape would be helpful, I think, and an expanded
outline of each program. The notes you sent are too sketchy;
books could be written about each item and have been written about
several of them. We would need an examination and opinion of
philosophical scholars to reach a good decision; and I am not
qualified in that manner.
To sum up, I think the idea has much promise, but needs to
be explored much further by people who know the history of
philosophical thought, I approve of the 15 minute program
format, since we need more shorter programs for our schedules.
Sincerely,
Kenneth D. Wright
Director of Broadcasting
